ＨＩ大家好，如果你有留意過我之前account (熊劉夢) 出過ge post，咁你應該都知我係讀邊一範。

我上連登出post 都好少咁formal，但係呢排因為好多人都畀濕疹同暗瘡困擾緊，而多左好多連登醫生出黎幫人睇病。幫人係好事，但係就算係西醫，你連最基本條友都未見過就話幫人睇病，最後只會越睇越病。

所以我特登開左一個新account出黎諗住只係討論一D長期病，同埋少少好基礎ge藥物知識。

出呢Ｄ學術post係唔收錢，不過我都唔多喜歡駛人唔駛本，所以下面有條link可以ge就幫手like下。入面只會archive返係度post過ge 文。

https://www.facebook.com/隨時收檔-442142526254124

我暫時唔打算係網上Ｒ生意，呢Ｄ野睇到就睇。不過多人睇就會搞落去，冇人睇就會收檔。

如果有咩病想我去research下 ge, 留個comment我會遲下去睇。如果係好specialised 果D 好似paediatrics, oncology 果D，我直頭唔會建議上連登搵任何人, 包括我。

So far 諗住會講一講濕疹同暗瘡，但絕對唔係睇病。

replies.msg:
係講中藥之前首先要知道點解一隻藥可以俾到一個EFFECT出黎



呢個係一個好簡單ge 例子。當你食完一隻藥，果個active pharmaceutical ingredient 會被身體吸收然後會跟住血循環游走全身。其間隻藥有機會被代謝，或者被身體排出（最主要都係算肝／腎）。

所謂代謝唔一定係 inactivate 隻藥，例如codeine 轉morphine



曾經有個例子就係有個阿媽食codeine 同時餵佢個仔食人奶，最後個Ｂ死左係因為佢阿媽可能有隻基因可以將隻藥快速代謝，導致Ｄ奶有大量morphine 而殺死左個B。
Koren, G, Cairns, J, Chitayat, G, and Leeder, SJ. Pharmacogenetics of morphine poisoning in a breast fed neonate of a codeine-prescribed mother. Lancet. 2006; 368: 704

所以藥物動力學係食藥ｇｅ其中一環，因為每個人ｇｅ體質，甚至面對ＧＥ化學物（例如：平時食開乜）都唔同。

而點解我咁唔鍾意中藥？

１　中藥冇清楚標明有乜野化學成份
２　中藥冇標明有「幾多」化學成份

同時我亦都唔肯定中藥有冇以下幾樣野

１　老人家同細路係唔係食成年人ＧＥ劑量
２　副作用列表
３　母乳／大肚ＧＥ影響

簡單講句，食完掂唔掂都係靠運。當然中醫仲可以撈到而家，以前Ｄ data 或多或少會幫到呢行，但就好似灌左鉛ＧＥ骰子。

replies.msg:
我摷返原文佢個abstract 係咁寫

"Cancer surgery while necessary for primary tumor removal, has been shown to induce immune suppression and promote metastases in preclinical models and human cancer surgery patients."

"...we evaluated the immunotherapeutic potential of phosphodiesterase-5 (PDE-5) inhibitors to target surgery-induced myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSC) and restore natural killer (NK) cell function in the clinically relevant perioperative period...."

所以唔係偉哥拎去醫癌，而係"Perioperative PDE5 inhibition reverses surgery-induced immunosuppression. "

Phosphodiesterase-5 inhibition reduces postoperative metastatic disease by targeting surgery-induced myeloid derived suppressor cell-dependent inhibition of Natural Killer cell cytotoxicity

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29872554

Abstract

...Recent data suggest the presence of two different forms of AD: an extrinsic AD with elevated IgE involving 70-80% of the patients and an intrinsic AD with serum IgE not elevated and no specific IgE. Patients with extrinsic AD have elevated Th2- and decreased Thl-expressing cells in the peripheral blood, with elevated IL-4 and IL-13 expression, as well as IL-5. On the contrary, the intrinsic AD is linked with much lower levels of IL-4 and IL-13. Genetic factors are involved in the control of the disease and in the intrinsic AD the same chromosomal regions seem to be associated with psoriasis susceptibility. The AD is characterized by a complex of immunological alterations involving interactions between IgE-bearing antigen-presenting cells, T-cell activation, mast-cell degranulation, keratinocytes, eosinophils, and a combination of immediate and cellular immune responses. Inflammatory dendritic epidermal cells constitute a distinct dendritic cells population that is mainly found in AD and could induce the Th2/Thl isotopic switch contributing to AD chronic phase. Therapy is based on interventation in the pathophysiology of atopic eczema and elimination of exogenous provocation factors.

照下耳仔囉，係Otitis media with effusion都唔頂。

Serous Otitis Media
In serous otitis media (otitis media with effusion), fluid is present in the middle ear for an extended period in the absence of signs and symptoms of infection. In general, acute effusions are self-limited; most resolve in 2–4 weeks. In some cases, however (in particular after an episode of acute otitis media), effusions can persist for months. These chronic effusions are often associated with significant hearing loss in the affected ear.

Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine

seizure

confusion
stiff neck
trouble breathing
severe pain anywhere in the body
swelling or inflammation of any part of the body
vaginal discharge that is discolored or smells bad
pain when urinating or urine that smells bad

How can I prevent vaginal candidiasis?

Wearing cotton underwear might help reduce the chances of getting a yeast infection.2 Because taking antibiotics can lead to vaginal candidiasis, take these medicines only when prescribed and exactly as your healthcare provider tells you.

Vaginal candidiasis is usually treated with antifungal medicine. For most infections, the treatment is an antifungal medicine applied inside the vagina or a single dose of fluconazole taken by mouth. For more severe infections, infections that don’t get better, or keep coming back after getting better, other treatments might be needed. These treatments include more doses of fluconazole taken by mouth or other medicines applied inside the vagina such as boric acid, nystatin, or flucytosine.

quote.msg: G6PD 缺乏症

replies.msg:
G6PD 全名係 葡萄糖-6-磷酸脱氫酶，好簡單咁講，呢個酵素用黎減低reactive oxygen species (ROS) 對細胞ge 傷害。



你可以見到G6PD係呢一串反應入面扮演緊ge角色，其中一個outcome就係少氧化物。

ROS 對人體好多component都有影響

１　紅血球　→　acute hemolytic anemia
２　傷害左細胞結構, 包括脂肪，細胞膜，蛋白質同埋 DNA.

咁ROS 點黎

係人體入面黎講，source 包括

１　腺粒體電子傳遞鏈
２　過量刺激 NAD(P)H

而當然體外 ROS 都會增加oxidative stress，例如

１　食煙
２　食藥
３　幅射
４　飲酒等等等等



所以如果因為基因導致G6PD無辦法可以正常運作，降低oxidative stress ge 效率就冇正常人咁好。



https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK470315/
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16978905
https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Endogenous-and-exogenous-sources-of-reactive-oxygen-species_fig2_221923481

點解老人家要食鈣／Vitamin D ?


１　食慾問題。一個老人定唔想食野就會少左好多營養，如果副甲狀腺sense到血唔夠鈣，就會call一隻叫做osteoclast ge細胞黎拆你舊骨去平衡返血鈣
２　吸收差左。食左落肚係變屎中間ＧＥ過程有消化同吸收，不過因為隨著年紀上，吸收能力下降，最後就算食足都未知吸收曬。
３　舊腎捉唔返Ｄ鈣。

"Age-related decline in kidney function can reduce renal expression of Klotho, leading to diminished vitamin D activation through fibroblast growth factor-23 (FGF23) signaling and impairment of renal tubular Ca2+ reabsorption [22]."

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3725483/

４　同埋老人家唔曬多Ｄ太陽，唔夠維他命Ｄ，又係幫助唔到鈣吸收

所以老人家食鈣／Vitamin D supplement其中一個原因就係保障返Ｄ骨夠硬，就算跌親都唔會易骨折。

咁痛呢？

低血鈣(hypocalcemia)果陣係有機會有平滑肌痛，不過鈣本身係身體有好多角色，你唔會因為唔痛而唔食返足夠ｇｅ鈣。

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK279022/

葡萄糖胺有乜用?


有好多研究關於食葡萄糖胺對osteoarthritis ge 幫助。

1. Effect of glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate in symptomatic knee osteoarthritis: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized placebo-controlled trials.

None of the glucosamine, chondroitin or their combination had a significant positive effect on the total WOMAC index and its subscores. Oral supplementation with glucosamine or chondroitin sulfate reduces pain in knee OA. However, there is no additional effect using both therapeutic agents in combination for the management of symptomatic knee OA.

2. Effectiveness and safety of glucosamine and chondroitin for the treatment of osteoarthritis: a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.

Given the effectiveness of these symptomatic slow-acting drugs, oral chondroitin is more effective than placebo on relieving pain and improving physical function. Glucosamine showed effect on stiffness outcome. Regarding on the limited number of combination therapy, further studies need to investigate the accurate effectiveness. This information accompanied with the tolerability and economic costs of included treatments would be conducive to making decisions for clinicians.

3. Glucosamine effects in humans: a review of effects on glucose metabolism, side effects, safety considerations and efficacy.

Side effects were significantly less common with glucosamine than placebo or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID). In contrast to NSAID, no serious or fatal side effects have been reported for glucosamine. Our critical evaluation indicates that glucosamine is safe under current conditions of use and does not affect glucose metabolism.

Muscle force compensation among synergistic muscles after fatigue of a single muscle.

It is concluded that synergistic muscles compensate each other. Furthermore, it seems that self-compensating mechanism of the fatigued muscles occurred additionally. The force compensation does not depend on the function of the fatigued muscle.

Influence of duty cycle on the time course of muscle fatigue and the onset of neuromuscular compensation during exhaustive dynamic isolated limb exercise.

These results indicate that the fatigue-induced compensatory behavior to recruit additional motor units is triggered by a reliance on anaerobic metabolism for ATP resynthesis and is independent of the absolute level or fraction of the maximum force produced by the muscle.

Influence of joint position on synergistic muscle activity after fatigue of a single muscle head.

CONCLUSIONS:
Synergistic muscles compensate for the fatigued muscle in the flexed position but not in the extended position. Compensation mechanisms seem to depend on joint position.

These results indicate that the fatigue-induced compensatory behavior to recruit additional motor units is triggered by a reliance on anaerobic metabolism for ATP resynthesis and is independent of the absolute level or fraction of the maximum force produced by the muscle.

Influence of joint position on synergistic muscle activity after fatigue of a single muscle head.

CONCLUSIONS:
Synergistic muscles compensate for the fatigued muscle in the flexed position but not in the extended position. Compensation mechanisms seem to depend on joint position.

Pruritus is a common and significant symptom of acne.

84 patients (70%) reported itch in acne. Patients who experienced itch in acne tended to be slightly older (p = 0.05). Majority of patients (83%) reported itch at noon and most experienced itch on a transient nature. The most common descriptor of itch was tickling (68%). Severity of pruritus in acne was comparable to mosquito-bite and it significantly affected patients' mood (55%). Common aggravating factors for the pruritus were sweat (71%), heat (62%) and stress (31%). A significant proportion of patients with itch (52%) had scratched or rubbed the affected area while 37% would wash the area to find relief.

不過我印象中有個management 叫做 low FODMAP diet


A recently devised dietary approach consists of restricting foods with highly fermentable oligo-, di-, and monosaccharides, as well as polyols (FODMAPs), which can trigger and/or exacerbate IBS symptoms [22,23]. FODMAPs are osmotically active short-chain carbohydrates (SCCs) that are poorly absorbed and rapidly fermented by gut bacteria [24,25,26]. Increased intraluminal water volume, due to osmotic activity and gas production from their fermentation, causes intestinal luminal distension and induces gastrointestinal symptoms in susceptible individuals [27]. Furthermore, FODMAPs also appear to be involved in symptom generation through direct and indirect effects on gut microbiota, gut barrier, immune response, and visceral sensation [28]. It has been reported that a low-FODMAP diet can have a positive impact on IBS symptoms [26,29,30,31,32].

但係

There is evidence that a low-FODMAP diet can have a favorable impact on IBS symptoms, especially abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhoea. However, it remains to be demonstrated whether a low-FODMAP diet is superior to conventional IBS diets, especially in the long term. In addition, further studies are needed to demonstrate whether the low-FODMAP diet is superior to the traditional IBS diet following the NICE guidelines in the long term. Long-term FODMAP depletion may entail physiological consequences on the intestinal microbiome, colonocyte metabolism, and nutritional status that should not be underestimated, and needs further investigation.

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5622700/

1. ＷＨＯ

Genital herpes infections often have no symptoms, or mild symptoms that go unrecognised. Most infected people are unaware that they have the infection. Typically, about 10-20% of people with HSV-2 infection report a prior diagnosis of genital herpes.

When symptoms do occur, genital herpes is characterised by one or more genital or anal blisters or open sores called ulcers. In addition to genital ulcers, symptoms of new genital herpes infections often include fever, body aches, and swollen lymph nodes.

After an initial genital herpes infection with HSV-2, recurrent symptoms are common but often less severe than the first outbreak. The frequency of outbreaks tends to decrease over time. People infected with HSV-2 may experience sensations of mild tingling or shooting pain in the legs, hips, and buttocks before the occurrence of genital ulcers.

2. Is herpes simplex a systemic disease?

...Most primary HSV infections are asymptomatic....

...HSV-2 can cause acute primary herpetic gingivostomatitis by oral-genital or oral-oral contact...

...Acute herpetic gingivostomatitis lasts 5 to 7 days, and the findings subside within 2 weeks. Viral shedding from the saliva may continue for 3 weeks or more....

...Primary genital herpes due to HSV-2 infection occurs 3 to 14 days after sexual contact. ...

...Acute herpetic lesions of the cervix, vagina, and vulva are characteristic for primary infection with HSV-2 ...

...Acute balanitis and urethritis...

Secondary infections

Pain, burning, or tingling at the site often precedes clinical symptoms. In a demarcated area, a small group of vesicles with clear contents appears on top of an erythematous base. After a few days, the vesicles gradually darken and dry out to become crusts....

...HSV-2 form a latent infection in the dorsal root ganglia. The main characteristic of these viruses is their ability to establish latency, maintain it for the entire lifespan of the host, and reactivate and cause primary and recurrent disease. ...

...HSV-2 infection may manifest also with acute generalized encephalitis in the neonatal period, more typically with aseptic meningitis and sometimes with a polyradiculutis or myelitis in adults...

...Some cases of acute disseminated encephalomyelitis due to HSV-1 and HSV-2 infection can be found in the literature, and it is a poor prognostic factor of ADEM recovery and management...

Postinfectious optic neuritis is another complication of HSV infection. It is usually bilateral and is slightly more common in children. ...

Vestibular neuritis is the most common cause of acute spontaneous vertigo and sometimes can be found as an HSV infection representation.

Although less common, an HSV infection can present as a peripheral nerve involvement, with clinical manifestations of neuropathic pain, sensory deficit, rarely a motor deficit, and in extreme cases poliradiculoneuropathy (Guillain-Barré syndrome).21

Hepatitis is a rare complication of HSV infections, often leading to acute liver failure, the need for liver transplantation, and death. ...

Herpetic esophagitis is often diagnosed in immunocompromised patients...

In recent studies of gastric erosions in patients with absence of peptic ulcer disease, a focally enhanced inflammation associated with HSV seropositivity was found as a main characteristic of the lesions.32 Few cases of HSV gastritis and colitis have been reported, and recently there have been reports of HSV duodenitis in patients with Crohn disease.33

Herpes simplex viral keratitis...

HSV infection has been found rarely to be associated with vasculitis ...

1. ＷＨＯ

HSV-2 is mainly transmitted during sex, through contact with genital surfaces, skin, sores or fluids of someone infected with the virus. HSV-2 can be transmitted from skin in the genital or anal area that looks normal and is often transmitted in the absence of symptoms.

In rare circumstances, HSV-2 infection can be transmitted from a mother to her infant during delivery.

2. Herpes myths vs facts

Myth: People with herpes are always infectious.

Fact: A person with herpes is not always infectious but the herpes virus is occasionally shed from the skin when symptoms are not present. Most of the time when you don't have herpes symptoms you are not infectious.

Myth: Herpes is passed through blood.

Fact: Herpes is not present in the blood. People with genital herpes can still donate blood. Genital herpes is only passed through direct skin-to-skin contact, both orally and genitally.

http://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/herpes-simplex-virus#hsv2
https://www.herpes.org.nz/patient-info/myths-vs-facts/

DSM 5叫Dissociative Identity Disorder,解離性人格障礙。

人格分裂嘅形成係因為患者有可能曾經遭遇極大創傷，潛意識下未能承受巨大創傷導致嘅壓力，而有機會形成嘅另外一個人格。

人格嘅出現或多或少將壓抑咗嘅恐懼、憤怒、悲痛（一切原人格不能承受嘅情緒）釋放。

可以有多於一個人格嘅出現，而原人格未必知道所有人格嘅存在，人格同人格之間未必有溝通，原人格嘅記憶會因為其他人格「佔用」佢嘅身體而有記憶缺失。

伴隨而嚟嘅可能有抑鬱症、焦慮症等等。

分裂出嚟嘅人格，有啲擔當保護者、觀察者等等。

一般而言出咗處理抑鬱、焦慮，會採用psychoanalytical approach, 佛洛伊德嗰套去治療患者。

有錯請指正

１　點解要食葡萄糖胺？


骨關節炎係一種關節退化ge疾病，隨著年紀增長，關節會變得越黎越硬／痛／多發炎等等。所以食藥係原因。
１　拖慢個退化
２　止痛

當然年齡只係其中一個風險因素，肥啊，基因問題都一樣會搞到個病。
咁平時止痛會食開NSAIDs （非類固醇消炎藥，布洛芬班friends）



但問題係食呢D類會有乜野問題？我係呢度唔會詳細講molecular mechanism，但係佢地有ge風險係

COX – I 抑制：傷個胃同埋影響凝血
COX – II抑制：消炎，止痛

所以冇選擇性COX-II 抑制就好易有胃病，但係選擇性COX-II 抑制係咪特別好？如果有胃病，答案係。不過就對個心血管好不利（呢Ｄ係下圖有解釋睇得明就睇，睇唔明就唔緊要。）

（出處：Cyclooxygenase-1 and -2: molecular targets for cervical neoplasia.）
因此亦都有研究話邊隻NSAIDs 有邊方面勁D ge副作用

（出處：http://circ.ahajournals.org/content/112/5/759）

除左呢Ｄ咁基本ge野，病人個ｐｒｏｆｉｌｅ都好重要，例如：
有冇哮喘，有冇過敏，有冇凝血問題，舊腎有冇事（呢樣係超緊要），係咪老人家用，有冇大肚等等

所以短時間用就話冇問題，呢Ｄ骨關節炎只會衰退，換言之長期食呢種藥，就好有問題。

咁樣除左人見人愛ge Panadol（正常劑量ＯＫ，過量一樣仆硬街），仲有冇其他野可以幫到骨關節炎啊？

好老實，個ＴＯＰＩＣ都叫得葡萄糖胺，就緊係拎葡萄糖胺黎做例子啦。
理論上黎講，葡萄糖胺食左落肚就會吸收入體內，再去到關節釋出止痛，減慢關節破壞同軟骨衰退。但係食左落肚都要過五關斬六將先有個效果，咁多嗲，係咪真係有效啊。

我終於知道乜野叫粒粒皆辛苦
仲有兩三個鐘就瞓，但係我仲打緊安全果堆野

拿，唔好話係中醫，基本上就連食落肚ge野你都一樣要小心有冇機會撞藥（多人ＬＩＫＥ個ＰＡＧＥ先再講）。一個好簡單ge例子，好多斯達汀（statin）都會同西柚汁撞，撞完之後隻藥就因為一隻酵素代謝唔到隻藥，搞到個病人好大機會有肌肉問題，例如横紋肌溶解症。

咁份” Glucosamine effects in humans: a review of effects on glucose metabolism, side effects, safety considerations and efficacy”佢話左D咩呢？

“... The most common symptoms reported with placebo or glucosamine were: mild gastrointestinal symptoms including constipation, diarrhea, nausea, dyspepsia, excessive gas, abdominal distension, and abdominal cramps; headache; and skin rash or pruritis.”

“In 13 of the 18 studies, symptoms were reported less commonly in glucosamine-treated subjects than in placebo-treated subjects. … Only two studies reported that symptoms were more common with glucosamine than placebo.”

“Five studies compared side effects of glucosamine with ibuprofen… The prevalence of side effects in patients using glucosamine was 10.0% compared to 32.5% for patients using ibuprofen.”

就咁聽落去，個副作用輕過而且少發生過布洛芬，喂咁食呢樣野實冇死啦？未必。

１　血糖影響

其實我一路都好驚Copy & paste 有版權問題，好簡單咁講，研究好多唔係insignificant，就係冇影響。但係如果糖尿病人想食葡萄糖胺，我諗你最好問下營養師先好。

２　撞藥

根據TRC 個natural medicine，有４種藥係會同glucosamine SULFATE撞

Paracetamol

Antidiabetic

Topoisomerase II inhibitors

Warfarin (Coumadin)

1. ＷＨＯ

HSV-2 is mainly transmitted during sex, through contact with genital surfaces, skin, sores or fluids of someone infected with the virus. HSV-2 can be transmitted from skin in the genital or anal area that looks normal and is often transmitted in the absence of symptoms.

In rare circumstances, HSV-2 infection can be transmitted from a mother to her infant during delivery.

2. Herpes myths vs facts

Myth: People with herpes are always infectious.

Fact: A person with herpes is not always infectious but the herpes virus is occasionally shed from the skin when symptoms are not present. Most of the time when you don't have herpes symptoms you are not infectious.

Myth: Herpes is passed through blood.

Fact: Herpes is not present in the blood. People with genital herpes can still donate blood. Genital herpes is only passed through direct skin-to-skin contact, both orally and genitally.

唔係太影響日常工作基本上唔駛登特去食藥／做手術，當然呢Ｄ都係醫生評估完先俾到意見你。

http://www.myastheniagravis.org/about-mg/treatments/

MG can be fought with traditional medicine. But how else can you take a measure of control over your illness?

Eat healthy. Like everyone, myasthenia patients should eat a healthy diet and maintain a healthy weight. This advice is critical for MG patients, because extra pounds make it even more fatiguing to get around and aggravate a host of other diseases. Talk to your doctor to see if a diet change will help ease medication side effects like fluid retention, bone loss or anemia.

Exercise. It boosts your mood as well as the health of your heart, brain and cardiovascular system. Naturally you have to tailor your activity to your illness. For example, when your disease is not well controlled, walking with assistance may be something to aim for. Exhaustion or shortness of breath means the exercise is too strenuous. As your MG improves, gradually add activity such as yoga, chair exercise, isometrics or more walking. Small progress is better than no progress!

Manage stress. Consult with your doctor and consider options such as acupuncture, biofeedback, meditation, or massage therapy.

Get outdoors. Researchers have found that people can improve their mood with a short time of outdoor exercise like walking or gardening.

Pretend you’re outdoors. Listening to recorded nature sounds can be very relaxing.

Talk to others. Combat isolation by calling friends and family. Or contact a support group.

感染邊度先？

先股癬黎講，通常你要搽藥膏都要搽幾個星期。因為殺死Ｄ癬最多果陣你唔會咁痕，但係Ｄ蛋仲未死得曬，所以當見好少少就停藥，咁樣係唔掂，好返少少仲要搽多一陣。

真係做運動 返黎再講

我之前唔音真菌感染，竟只識用皮淡平，時好時唔好

前兩星期終於走去睇皮膚科

醫生話係 tinea corporis

食左一星期Lamisil (Terbinafine) 250mg
茶緊第三星期 Onabet (sertaconazole nitrate 2%)

而家圈圈時紅時不紅，但圈中間有小小脫皮

醫生叫我要加埋petroleum gel cover 個D圈圈

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3827518/

Efficacy and Safety of Terbinafine Hydrochloride 1% Cream vs. Sertaconazole Nitrate 2% Cream in Tinea Corporis and Tinea Cruris: A Comparative Therapeutic Trial

In group B (sertaconazole nitrate 2%), not a single patient showed complete cure at the end of first week. 73.33% and 100% patients showed complete clinical cure at the end of 2nd and 3rd week of treatment.

petroleum 愛黎保濕姐～冇問題，除非用完衰過用。

不過你皮膚幾星期開始唔痕？

replies.msg:
我太太話照ct同mri，都無俾任何圖案或圖畫佢睇，只係就咁訓係到照，如果見到有好多花紋，或者好多唔同顏色的物件，佢形容既畫面就好似d野好輕微咁震動，但如果單起任何一隻眼睇，又會正常返，只係雙眼先會見到d野係到震，我有問過佢係咪見到d野有重影，但佢話d野無兩個影像，只係好輕微咁震，但係睇2至3秒就已經開始頭暈同無精神

另外，佢話淨色或者無咩線條圖案既野，都唔會見到震，其實唔知係咪因為無咩顏色線條分別，所以有震都唔知，暫時佢話最恐怖係見到超市既貨架，因為所有貨唔同色，包裝又多花紋同線條，好似全部野都震緊，仲有正常睇電視佢話無震既情況，但只要畫面定格，佢都會見到d野震

我都有同佢做過好多實驗，例如將燈光校到好暗，佢話平時見到會震既野都會正常，另外如果戴偏光鏡既太陽眼鏡出街，就算d野會震，對眼都睇得無咁辛苦

唔好意思，可能比較多字，但我想形容得仔細d比你知，麻煩晒你

quote.msg:
謝謝你回覆

佢病發之前無食開藥,只係2013年右耳有突發性失聰,手術後回復7成聽力,另外上年11月中曾經小產,佢社交方面都正常,有間中同朋友食飯,今年36歲,佢屋企人無呢方面既同樣問題,病發前生活上細節都沒有轉變

之前睇過多次耳鼻喉科,眼科醫生,另外又入醫院照過腦部CT,又去過體檢中心,做詳細身體檢查,抽血,驗大小便,照全身MRI(包括腦部),全部都話正常,仲有都去過護眼中心做詳細驗眼,都係一切正常,所以都搵唔到問題,最近睇的眼科醫生,都話可能係眼肌問題或眼疲勞,除左休息無野可以做到

請問如果係眼肌問題,係咪都係應該睇番眼科? 不過眼科醫生又話無野做到,真係好無助

畀少少時間我刨下文。
因為當你講到腦都scan埋我都唔知要點諗好。我想問多少少

scan個腦果陣有冇畀「眼花ｇｅ圖案」睇？
係望幾耐先開始對焦唔到？
係唔係望screen果陣個情況仲衰？

我太太話照ct同mri，都無俾任何圖案或圖畫佢睇，只係就咁訓係到照，如果見到有好多花紋，或者好多唔同顏色的物件，佢形容既畫面就好似d野好輕微咁震動，但如果單起任何一隻眼睇，又會正常返，只係雙眼先會見到d野係到震，我有問過佢係咪見到d野有重影，但佢話d野無兩個影像，只係好輕微咁震，但係睇2至3秒就已經開始頭暈同無精神

另外，佢話淨色或者無咩線條圖案既野，都唔會見到震，其實唔知係咪因為無咩顏色線條分別，所以有震都唔知，暫時佢話最恐怖係見到超市既貨架，因為所有貨唔同色，包裝又多花紋同線條，好似全部野都震緊，仲有正常睇電視佢話無震既情況，但只要畫面定格，佢都會見到d野震

我都有同佢做過好多實驗，例如將燈光校到好暗，佢話平時見到會震既野都會正常，另外如果戴偏光鏡既太陽眼鏡出街，就算d野會震，對眼都睇得無咁辛苦

唔好意思，可能比較多字，但我想形容得仔細d比你知，麻煩晒你

replies.msg:
冇問題，呢Ｄ野越多info越好。

不過點都好，記住一樣野，我最多只可以幫你摷Ｄ資料俾你去問醫生。

replies.msg:
完全明白，真係好多謝你既熱心幫忙

其實我呢幾個月都上網睇左好多資料，開頭睇眼球震顫，睇晒資料後都懷疑係前庭神經炎引起，但睇左幾個都話佢唔係眼球震顫

之後又覺得可能關眼外肌麻痺事，但醫生話無野做到，只係可以休息多d，等佢自己好返

佢平時個人都好多野想，同埋個人好負面，所以我都懷疑唔知佢係咪神經衰弱，但唔知係個病影響定其他原因，佢眼有事後，成日都話心跳快同重，有時又話心悸同要抖大氣，夜晚又成日訓得唔好，間中會失眠同發惡夢，所以睡眠質素好差，成日訓醒都仲係好倦，好似無訓過咁，唔知係咪因為呢d原因，所以一直休息唔到，咁耐都好唔番

係腦電圖 一時轉唔返中文台

replies.msg:
唔好介意我問清楚d，因為我唔係好識，我見腦電圖主要用途如下，請問係咪都會有幫助?

1．癲癇：腦電圖對癲癇診斷價值最大，可以幫助確定診斷和分型，判斷預後和分析療效；

2．腦外傷：普通檢查難以確定的輕微損傷腦電圖可能發現異常；

3．對診斷腦腫瘤或損傷有一定幫助；

4．判斷腦部是否有器質性病變，特別對判斷是精神病還是腦炎等其他疾病造成的精神症状很有價值，還能區別癔病，詐病或者是真正有腦部疾病；

5．用於生物反饋治療。

quote.msg: 請問係腦電圖嗎？請問同ct及mri有什麼分別?

3．對診斷腦腫瘤或損傷有一定幫助；

4．判斷腦部是否有器質性病變，特別對判斷是精神病還是腦炎等其他疾病造成的精神症状很有價值，還能區別癔病，詐病或者是真正有腦部疾病；

5．用於生物反饋治療。

replies.msg:
睇neurologist，唔知係香港睇係咪要refer ，呢Ｄ你可以去打電話問

base on 個dialouges 我generalized 成兩part ，當然同你傾ge時間唔長，資料肯定唔會全面

１　頭暈及經常疲倦
２　上年11月中曾經小產
３　戴偏光鏡既太陽眼鏡出街，就算d野會震，對眼都睇得無咁辛苦
４　另外，佢話淨色或者無咩線條圖案既野，都唔會見到震，其實唔知係咪因為無咩顏色線條分別，所以有震都唔知，暫時佢話最恐怖係見到超市既貨架，因為所有貨唔同色，包裝又多花紋同線條，好似全部野都震緊，仲有正常睇電視佢話無震既情況，但只要畫面定格，佢都會見到d野震
５　單起任何一隻眼睇，又會正常返，只係雙眼先會見到d野係到震

呢個我覺得如果ＧＰ俾唔到建議你，你應該去睇一睇neurologist

１　佢眼有事後，成日都話心跳快同重，有時又話心悸同要抖大氣，夜晚又成日訓得唔好，間中會失眠同發惡夢，所以睡眠質素好差，成日訓醒都仲係好倦，好似無訓過咁，唔知係咪因為呢d原因，所以一直休息唔到，咁耐都好唔番

呢個我覺得只係因為隻眼ｇｅ問題搞到Quality of life受影響。不過點都好，一切都要睇醫生。


當然呢Ｄ你都要同返個醫生講
佢病發之前無食開藥,只係2013年右耳有突發性失聰,手術後回復7成聽力,另外上年11月中曾經小產,佢社交方面都正常,有間中同朋友食飯,今年36歲,佢屋企人無呢方面既同樣問題,病發前生活上細節都沒有轉變

之前睇過多次耳鼻喉科,眼科醫生,另外又入醫院照過腦部CT,又去過體檢中心,做詳細身體檢查,抽血,驗大小便,照全身MRI(包括腦部),全部都話正常,仲有都去過護眼中心做詳細驗眼,都係一切正常,所以都搵唔到問題,最近睇的眼科醫生,都話可能係眼肌問題或眼疲勞,除左休息無野可以做到


最後你有冇食過乜野中藥／補品／維他命之類，乜乜柒柒都要報告俾個醫生。

呢Ｄ千祈咪靠自己上網搵資料判斷
我呢度最多都係教你點去睇醫生 唔係教你點樣去醫人

base on 個dialouges 我generalized 成兩part ，當然同你傾ge時間唔長，資料肯定唔會全面

１　頭暈及經常疲倦
２　上年11月中曾經小產
３　戴偏光鏡既太陽眼鏡出街，就算d野會震，對眼都睇得無咁辛苦
４　另外，佢話淨色或者無咩線條圖案既野，都唔會見到震，其實唔知係咪因為無咩顏色線條分別，所以有震都唔知，暫時佢話最恐怖係見到超市既貨架，因為所有貨唔同色，包裝又多花紋同線條，好似全部野都震緊，仲有正常睇電視佢話無震既情況，但只要畫面定格，佢都會見到d野震
５　單起任何一隻眼睇，又會正常返，只係雙眼先會見到d野係到震

呢個我覺得如果ＧＰ俾唔到建議你，你應該去睇一睇neurologist

１　佢眼有事後，成日都話心跳快同重，有時又話心悸同要抖大氣，夜晚又成日訓得唔好，間中會失眠同發惡夢，所以睡眠質素好差，成日訓醒都仲係好倦，好似無訓過咁，唔知係咪因為呢d原因，所以一直休息唔到，咁耐都好唔番

呢個我覺得只係因為隻眼ｇｅ問題搞到Quality of life受影響。不過點都好，一切都要睇醫生。


當然呢Ｄ你都要同返個醫生講
佢病發之前無食開藥,只係2013年右耳有突發性失聰,手術後回復7成聽力,另外上年11月中曾經小產,佢社交方面都正常,有間中同朋友食飯,今年36歲,佢屋企人無呢方面既同樣問題,病發前生活上細節都沒有轉變

之前睇過多次耳鼻喉科,眼科醫生,另外又入醫院照過腦部CT,又去過體檢中心,做詳細身體檢查,抽血,驗大小便,照全身MRI(包括腦部),全部都話正常,仲有都去過護眼中心做詳細驗眼,都係一切正常,所以都搵唔到問題,最近睇的眼科醫生,都話可能係眼肌問題或眼疲勞,除左休息無野可以做到


最後你有冇食過乜野中藥／補品／維他命之類，乜乜柒柒都要報告俾個醫生。
唔好意思，仲想問清楚少少，請問我應該帶太太睇神經外科，定係腦神經科?  因為我驚攪錯

https://hk.news.appledaily.com/local/daily/article/20120812/16597062

內科和外科的分野在哪裏?
大概對醫療稍有認識的人都能告訴你，開藥給你吃的是內科醫生，而替你開刀的是外科醫生。
多年前曾有病人跟我說：「外科醫生可以處理皮膚疾患、瘡瘤、外傷等，但要開胸剖腹當然要請內科醫生來了！」令初入行的我啼笑皆非。
我的外科啟蒙老師高倫斯教授的要求是：「外科醫生是能開刀的內科大夫。」
內科醫生文質彬彬，喜歡抽絲剝繭解決問題；外科醫生粗豪，往往要在電光火石中作判斷，過的是刀頭舐血的日子。在醫院裏，內科和外科醫生「不咬絃」，是司空見慣的事。
從醫院的架構上，內科和外科也是壁壘分明。內外科病房在醫院各據一方。同是消化系統出了問題的病人，有些分在內科病房，有些分在外科病房，各按自己的一套方法處理。在內科病房的病人，若果病情有變需要動手術，要請外科醫生來會診。病情凶險，要緊急手術的，往往會引起不必要的延誤。
近年有了內窺鏡手術，不用開膛破腹，就可以用微創手術來止血，取石和割除腫瘤。內外科的分界線更加糢糊。
從病人的角度看，最好當然是住進綜合病房，內外科醫生一起會診，按照病情，替他選擇最合適的治療方案。選用藥物治療、內鏡治療、微創手術、傳統剖腹抑或介入治療，只考慮患者的需要，不用理會主診醫生是外科還是內科。但要完全打破內科和外科醫生之間世世代代遺留下來的鴻溝，不是一朝一夕的事！
其實，胃潰瘍就是胃潰瘍，膽結石就是膽結石，胰腺炎就是胰腺炎，又有甚麼外科內科之分呢？

鍾尚志教授

https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2633918

Should All Groin Hernias Be Repaired?

A groin hernia will not get better on its own, but not all groin hernias need to be repaired. The decision to repair the hernia depends on the type of hernia and amount of pain and discomfort you experience and its interference with activity. A surgeon may repair a hernia with a single incision (open surgery) or with multiple smaller incisions (laparoscopic surgery). The hernia is closed by either bringing the groin tissue back together or placing a prosthetic (manmade) mesh over the hernia. However, if the hernia is not painful or does not limit daily activities and there is a low risk of a strangulated hernia, you and your doctor may choose to monitor your hernia without surgery. The risks associated with hernia surgery include prolonged pain, bleeding, infection, nerve damage, damage to surrounding blood vessels, and damage to nearby organs including the intestines and, in men, the testicles.

A hernia truss is a supportive undergarment designed to keep the protruding tissue in place. Although some individuals with symptomatic hernias report more comfort and support while wearing a truss, some patients have continued pain and discomfort. Your surgeon can help you decide if a truss is a good option for you.

https://www.orthopaedics.com.sg/treatments/orthopaedic-surgeries/screw-fixation/

What is ORIF Surgery?

An open reduction internal fixation (ORIF) refers to a surgical procedure to fix a severe bone fracture, or break. “Open reduction” means surgery is needed to realign the bone fracture into the normal position. “Internal fixation” refers to the steel rods, screws, or plates used to keep the bone fracture stable in order to heal the right way and to help prevent infection.

ORIF Surgery Complications

...Other factors that can affect recovery are the location and severity of the break, the age of the person, and the type of bone broken.

quote.msg: 可唔可以講下rosacea

replies.msg:
Rosacea is a common chronic relapsing inflammatory skin condition which mostly affects the central face, with women being more affected than men.1 The pathophysiology is not completely understood, but dysregulation of the immune system, as well as changes in the nervous and the vascular system have been identified. Microbes that are part of the normal skin flora, and specifically in the pilo-sebaceous unit – including Demodex mites and Staphylococcus epidermidis – may also play a role as triggers of rosacea.2,3

Symptoms are initially transient. This is followed by persistent erythema due to repeated vasodilation, then telangiectasia and skin inflammation in the form of papules, pustules, lymphoedema and fibrosis.2,4

Rosacea can seriously affect a patient’s quality of life. This should prompt clinicians to diagnose it early and start treatment.1

replies.msg:
https://www.aafp.org/afp/2000/0515/p3025.html

How is prostatitis treated?

The treatment is based on the cause. Your doctor may do a rectal exam and test urine samples to find out the cause.

An antibiotic is used to treat prostatitis that is caused by an infection. Some antibiotics that might be used are trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, doxycycline, ciprofloxacin, norfloxacin and ofloxin. You might have to take antibiotics for several weeks or even a few months. If prostatitis is severe, you might have to go to a hospital for treatment with fluids and antibiotics.

quote.msg: 扁桃腺發炎 扁桃腺翻發

replies.msg:
What causes tonsillitis
The tonsils are glands at both sides of the back of your throat that help protect you against infection. Tonsillitis is usually caused by a virus, or occasionally by bacteria, and often follows a cold.

You can’t be immunised against tonsillitis so you can’t prevent it, although good hygiene can help. You can have it more than once.

https://www.healthdirect.gov.au/tonsillitis


Surgery
Some people who have recurring bouts of tonsillitis will be offered surgery to remove their tonsils. The operation is known as a tonsillectomy.

People who have a tonsillectomy need a general anaesthetic, and often stay in hospital overnight. There is a risk of heavy bleeding after the operation. It doesn't prevent sore throats coming back. Some people have a lot of pain afterwards, and it can take up to two weeks to recover.

You should talk to your doctor or ear, nose and throat specialist about whether a tonsillectomy is likely to help you.

Dimenhydrinate is an ethanolamine and first-generation histamine antagonist with anti-allergic activity. Dimenhydrinate competitively blocks H1 receptors, thereby preventing the actions of histamine on bronchial smooth muscle, capillaries and gastrointestinal (GI) smooth muscle. This prevents histamine-induced bronchoconstriction, vasodilation, increased capillary permeability, GI smooth muscle spasm.


SYMPTOMS: Symptoms associated with this compound include: drowsiness, lethargy, fatigue hypnosis and coma. Initial sedation may be followed by central nervous system hyperexcitability. Also, the victim may experience dry mouth, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, abdominal distress, constipation, and/or diarrhea. (NTP, 1992)

https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/compound/dimenhydrinate#section=Top

Overview of Current Concepts in Gastric Intestinal Metaplasia and Gastric Cancer

Gastric intestinal metaplasia is a precancerous change of the mucosa of the stomach with intestinal epithelium, and is associated with an increased risk of dysplasia and cancer. The pathogenesis to gastric cancer is proposed by the Correa hypothesis as the transition from normal gastric epithelium to invasive cancer via inflammation followed by intramucosal cancer and invasion. Multiple risk factors have been associated with the development of gastric intestinal metaplasia interplay, including Helicobacter pylori infection and associated genomics, host genetic factors, environmental milieu, rheumatologic disorders, diet, and intestinal microbiota. Globally, screening guidelines have been established in countries with high incidence. In the United States, no such guidelines have been developed due to lower, albeit increasing, incidence. The American Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy recommends a case-by-case patient assessment based upon epidemiology, genetics, and environmental risk factors. Studies have examined the use of a serologic biopsy to stratify risk based upon factors such as H pylori status and virulence factors, along with serologic markers of chronic inflammation including pepsinogen I, pepsinogen II, and gastrin. High-risk patients may then be advised to undergo endoscopic evaluation with mapping biopsies from the antrum (greater curvature, lesser curvature), incisura angularis, and corpus (greater curvature, lesser curvature). Surveillance guidelines have not been firmly established for patients with known gastric intestinal metaplasia, but include repeat endoscopy at intervals according to the histologic risk for malignant transformation.

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5866308/
